garrett_arrives_final.speaker: Narrator
garrett_arrives_final.text: Garrett arrives early today, carrying a small basket covered with a cloth. There's a lightness about him you haven't seen before.

garrett_basket.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_basket.text: *He sets the basket on the counter with trembling hands* I made it. Last night. Her Memory Bread. First time in three years I stepped into the kitchen to cook.

garrett_cooking_story.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_cooking_story.text: I was terrified. My hands shook. I kept hearing her voice - 'A little more honey, Garrett. Don't be stingy.' But for the first time, it made me laugh instead of cry.

garrett_result.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_result.text: *He pulls back the cloth to reveal golden loaves* It's not perfect. Eleanor's never were either, though she'd never admit it. But it's... it's hers. And now it's mine too.

garrett_offer.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_offer.text: *He pulls out the worn recipe card* I want you to have this. Not to keep in a pocket - to use. To share. Let Eleanor's bread bring joy to others, the way it brought joy to us.

player_receive_garrett_recipe.speaker: Narrator
player_receive_garrett_recipe.text: Garrett offers you his wife's treasured recipe.

choices.text: I'll honor her memory with every loaf I bake.
Are you sure? This is your most precious possession.

garrett_touched.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_touched.text: *Tears flow freely, but he's smiling* That's all I ask. Not that you remember me, or even her. Just that you keep the bread alive. Keep the love it was made with alive.

garrett_certain.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_certain.text: My most precious possession is right here. *He taps his chest* The fifty-two years we had. The recipe is just... directions. The love was never in the paper.

garrett_gift_bread.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_gift_bread.text: Now - *he pushes the basket toward you* - you must taste it. Tell me honestly. I need to know if I got it right.

player_tastes.speaker: Narrator
player_tastes.text: You take a piece of the still-warm bread. It's simple, humble, but the flavor... there's something in it that can't be measured. Warmth. Home. Love.

garrett_reaction.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_reaction.text: *He watches your face intently* Well? Does it... is it...?

player_verdict.speaker: You
player_verdict.text: Garrett... this tastes like every happy moment I've ever had. All at once.

garrett_relief.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_relief.text: *He lets out a breath he seems to have been holding for years* Then she's still here. In every bite. She always will be.

garrett_final.speaker: Old Man Garrett
garrett_final.text: Thank you. Not for the kind words. For giving an old man a place to remember, and a reason to stop just remembering and start living again.
